column5: So who else won a free cruise to the bahamas from the sportmans show? Anyone taking the offer?
I won't fill out anything at those shows anymore. The barrage of phone calls after is unbearable..
Ya and the cruise is 3 days and you have to pay for transportation to and from the boat.  Good deal  I learned a long time ago not to fill out those forms either.  Joey
My wife will never learn.  I've had 5 calls for Cranberry Resort so far.
Those things are all around down here too.  Sports Shows, Shopping Centers ... you name it.   Just about the only contest you can enter with a pretty much guarantted certainty of winning.
Are ya gonna bring T-Pain with ya ? hahaha.
Cranberry has a real nice golf course.  LOL
Taboo's is real nice and I can get a break there, if i was golfing any more.
if it sounds to be good to be true it is.
ROFLMAO.... love that video!!! why wouldn't you bring T-Pain... hahaha
StylinCatch..  hahaahaahh Man the best video ever LOL..  IM ON A BOAT!!!

I once filled out one of those "Win a Cruise" forms at previous events... since then, I've learned my lesson and never bothered to ever fill them in again.  Basically what happend - they told me all they need is my 'Credit Card Number' - at 1st, it never occurred to me...but at the time, they told me that they need it for whatever reason (can't remember what reason they gave). So - the sucker I am - I gave my number - As I was talking with one of their reps on the phone - I later found out, they would charge a 'small' amount to my card ONLY when I decide to take the trip (7yr time frame to take my trip/cruise). So of course, I didn't worry......2-3 days later, I find a ABSURD AMOUNT charged to my VISA! what the heck?! I FREEEEAKED!! I called them back, basically gave them a piece of my mind!! OMG! You wouldn't want to be the REP that took my call that day....it later clicked in.. "If I "Won" this trip? why would they ask for a credit card number".... wow, I was young and naive!! Anyway, since then - I don't even bother.  Actually.....  The only time they might catch my attention - is when one of their gorgeous girls approach me
Never fill out any "Win a cruise, win a car, win anything, etc" forms. They are all too good to be true and your information will be sold, thus, you getting spam calls, mails, etc.
I'm saving up all mine for a 30 day cruise.
